title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research For Beginners Tutorial 3: Using Google

tactics.name: Google Suggested Keywords
tactics.description: Use Google's autocomplete suggestions to find relevant keywords by typing a base keyword and appending letters of the alphabet.
steps: Use incognito mode to avoid search history interference
Adjust language/region settings for target marketplace
Append each letter of the alphabet to the keyword
caveats: Suggestions may include non-Amazon search intent
source_quotes: Google users are often in discovery mode, seeking information and answers.

tactics.name: Related Searches Section
tactics.description: Identify new keywords by analyzing Google's 'Related Searches' section on product search results.
steps: Search for a product term (e.g., 'Graph Paper Notebook')
Scroll to the bottom of the Google Search Results Page
Prioritize low-competition phrases like 'large graph paper notebooks'
caveats: Results may include non-Amazon search intent
source_quotes: Some people search for 'large graph paper notebooks' when looking to buy on Amazon.

tactics.name: Image Search Keywords
tactics.description: Discover product-related keywords by analyzing Google Images search results.
steps: Search for a product term (e.g., 'Graph Paper Notebook')
Capture related terms displayed above image results
caveats: Terms may lack search volume data
source_quotes: Consider this area a hidden gold mine that Google provides.

tactics.name: Check Compare Section
tactics.description: Identify relevant keywords by reviewing other brands in the 'Compare with similar items' section.
steps: Check Google Keyword Planner results for other brands
caveats: Requires manual verification to avoid irrelevant keywords
source_quotes: Google Keyword Planner may show you some other brand’s name as a keyword

tactics.name: Reverse Engineer Top Products
tactics.description: Analyze high-ranking Amazon products in Google search results to identify optimization strategies.
source_quotes: Reverse engineering products that are already ranked at the top of Google search results

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: five powerful methods for uncovering low-competition keywords

claims.statement: 60% of US online shoppers start product searches on Amazon
source_quotes: over 60% of US online shoppers start their product search on Amazon.

claims.statement: Google Keyword Planner provides estimated search volumes for keywords
source_quotes: Google’s Keyword Planner is a free tool that provides estimated search volumes for any word or phrase.

claims.statement: Additional free keyword research methods will be revealed in future videos.
source_quotes: upcoming videos of this Amazon KDP Keyword Research Tutorial Series

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with unique constraints for keyword optimization.
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Focuses on underserved markets with lower competition
source_quotes: create a separate video dedicated solely to this topic
